markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 3+"
    pfs=""
>
[Survey Map](/Equipment.aspx?ID=65)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 291 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Maps are uncommon. Most maps you can find are simple and functional. A survey map details a single location in excellent detail. One of these maps gives you a +1 item bonus to [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) checks and any skill checks to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26), provided the checks are related to the location detailed on the map. Maps sometimes come in atlases, containing a number of maps of the same quality, often on similar topics. An atlas costs five times as much as a single map and requires both hands to use. The GM determines what maps are available in any location.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"

pfs="Standard"
>
Survey Map
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 291 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) All characters have access to the scholarly journal, scholarly journal compendium, survey map, and survey map atlas_

**Price** 10 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Hands** 1

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

level="2"
right="Item 3"
pfs="Standard"
>

</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 291 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 50 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Hands** 2

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>
